snippet: Those arrested are thought to be Uighurs, a Turkic people from western China who have suffered repression from the ethnic Han who rule China.
abstract: Thai police raiding jungle camp in southern Thailand detain about 220 people suspected of being ethnic Uighurs fleeing China, two-thirds of them women and children; Uighurs have suffered repression from ethnic Han who rule China.

byline.contributor: Poypiti Amatatham contributed reporting from Bangkok.

lead_paragraph: Those arrested are thought to be Uighurs, a Turkic people from western China who have suffered repression from the ethnic Han who rule China.

headline.main: 220 Are Detained in Raid on a Thai Jungle Camp
headline.print_headline: 220 Are Detained in Raid on a Thai Jungle Camp

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
